intro: Triclisperma, commonly known as the three-lobed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features showy, clustered flowers that range from white to pink, often with a distinctive orange or yellow corona. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Triclisperma is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
